articles.headline: Boehner Fends Off Dissent as G.O.P. Takes the Reins
articles.snippet: Representative John A. Boehner beat back a challenge to his speakership from aggrieved conservatives as Republicans assumed control of both houses of Congress, pledging to restore function and civility.
articles.abstract: Representative John A. Boehner beat back a challenge to his speakership from aggrieved conservatives as Republicans assumed control of both houses of Congress, pledging to restore function and civility.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Representative John A. Boehner beat back an embarrassing challenge to his speakership from aggrieved conservatives on Tuesday as Republicans assumed control of both houses of Congress, pledging to restore function and civility to a body that has become a symbol of disorder for most Americans.

articles.headline: Jeb Bush Begins Wooing Donors for a 2016 Bid
articles.snippet: The former Florida governor laid out a campaign rationale and opened a fund-raising apparatus for a possible presidential campaign.
articles.abstract: The former Florida governor laid out a campaign rationale and opened a fund-raising apparatus for a possible presidential campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jeb Bush on Tuesday delivered a powerful message about two of the most vital ingredients in a presidential campaign, money and ideas, transforming himself from a figure who once seemed paralyzed by ambivalence over a White House run into the most forceful presence within the emerging Republican field.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and Nicholas Confessore

articles.headline: What Rising Airline Fees Tell Us About the Cable Industry
articles.snippet: Unbundling sounds promising, but more choice and the possibility of paying less do not necessarily translate into consumer satisfaction.
articles.abstract: Unbundling sounds promising, but more choice and the possibility of paying less do not necessarily translate into consumer satisfaction.
articles.lead_paragraph: The day when people are no longer forced to pay for dozens of cable channels they never watch seems to be coming nearer. But subscribers may want to be careful what they wish for.

articles.headline: House Republicans Change Rules on Calculating Economic Impact of Bills
articles.snippet: The long-sought shift to “dynamic scoring” is widely seen as a way for Republican leaders to set new ground rules for an overhaul of the entire tax code.
articles.abstract: The long-sought shift to “dynamic scoring” is widely seen as a way for Republican leaders to set new ground rules for an overhaul of the entire tax code.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After the drama of electing a new speaker of the House and the changing of control in the Senate, the House on Tuesday approved an obscure but significant rule change requiring the economic effects of legislation to be included in a bill’s official cost to the Treasury.

articles.headline: Soaring Bond Prices May Sound an Economic Warning
articles.snippet: The bond market is flashing warning signs as higher prices create lower yields.
articles.abstract: The bond market is flashing warning signs as higher prices create lower yields.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States economy is accelerating, unemployment is falling and wages are even beginning to creep higher.

articles.headline: Intel Allocates $300 Million for Workplace Diversity
articles.snippet: The fund is intended to help attract more women and minorities to the technology field and make the industry more hospitable to them once they get there.
articles.abstract: The fund is intended to help attract more women and minorities to the technology field and make the industry more hospitable to them once they get there.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Over the last year, Apple, Google and other big technology companies have faced mounting criticism by civil rights leaders about the lack of diversity in their work forces, which are populated mostly by white and Asian men.

articles.headline: Effort on Ebola Hurt W.H.O. Chief
articles.snippet: Critics of Margaret Chan have said she lets governments around the world steer the W.H.O. to fit their own needs, instead of firmly taking the helm as the world’s doctor in chief.
articles.abstract: Critics of Margaret Chan have said she lets governments around the world steer the W.H.O. to fit their own needs, instead of firmly taking the helm as the world’s doctor in chief.
articles.lead_paragraph: GENEVA — Under a stormy sky, on a boat to a G-8 summit meeting, a media-savvy Hong Kong pediatrician named Margaret Chan first met her country’s president, Hu Jintao. In a preview of the political maneuvering to come, he told her privately that China was considering backing her for the top post at the World Health Organization.

articles.headline: On the Open Road, Signs of a Changing Cuba
articles.snippet: A road trip across the island revealed a slowly changing Cuba — beautiful, tired and looking ahead.
articles.abstract: A road trip across the island revealed a slowly changing Cuba — beautiful, tired and looking ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAVANA — The signs of the times speak loudly in Cuba, sometimes through their silence.

articles.headline: Prices Fall and Worry Escalates in the Eurozone
articles.snippet: The decline, raising fears of economic stagnation, increases pressure on the European Central Bank to prevent a debilitating downward price spiral.
articles.abstract: The decline, raising fears of economic stagnation, increases pressure on the European Central Bank to prevent a debilitating downward price spiral.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Europe’s economy has reached a psychological inflection point.

articles.headline: Terrorists Strike Charlie Hebdo Newspaper in Paris, Leaving 12 Dead
articles.snippet: Hamyd Mourad, 18, suspected in an assault on the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo, walked into a police station northeast of Paris and gave himself up. The other suspects are two brothers, Said and Chérif Kouachi.
articles.abstract: Hamyd Mourad, 18, suspected in an assault on the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo, walked into a police station northeast of Paris and gave himself up. The other suspects are two brothers, Said and Chérif Kouachi.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The police organized an enormous manhunt across the Paris region on Wednesday for three suspects they said were involved in a brazen and methodical midday slaughter at a satirical newspaper that had lampooned Islam.
articles.byline: By Dan Bilefsky and Maïa de la Baume

articles.headline: In a World of Phones, Gadgets Must Adapt
articles.snippet: With apps able to act as cameras, media players and so much more, the world of consumer electronics is in turmoil as smartphones supersede all other devices.
articles.abstract: With apps able to act as cameras, media players and so much more, the world of consumer electronics is in turmoil as smartphones supersede all other devices.
articles.lead_paragraph: Technology fanatics descend every January on Las Vegas for the International CES, a colossal gathering of gadgetry and geekery where some of the world’s largest companies show off their best ideas for the future.
